title: U.S. Jobless Claims Decreased Last Week
text:
By Sarah Chaney and Amara Omeokwe

The number of Americans applying for first-time unemployment benefits fell last week, remaining at historically low levels. Here are key takeaways from Thursday's Labor Department report:

--Initial jobless claims declined 6,000 to 212,000 in the week ending Oct. 19, the Labor Department said Thursday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expected jobless claims to clock in at 215,000.

--Weekly jobless claims can be volatile. The four-week moving average decreased by 750 to 215,000.

--Continuing claims, those filed by workers unemployed for longer than a week, fell by 1,000 to 1.682 million in the week ending Oct. 12.

The Labor Department report on jobless claims can be accessed at: https://www.dol.gov/ui/data.pdf.

Write to Sarah Chaney at sarah.chaney@wsj.com and Amara Omeokwe at amara.omeokwe@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 24, 2019 08:45 ET (12:45 GMT)
